div.head: CHAP. XCIII.
The Maiestie, Power, and Holinesse of Christs Kingdome.
div.ab: The Lord reigneth, he is clothed with Maiestie, the Lord is clothed with strength, wherewith hee hath girded himselfe: the world also is stablished, that it cannot be moued.
Thy throne is established of old: thou art from euerlasting. Heb. from then.
The floods haue lifted vp, O Lord, the floods haue lifted vp their voice: the floods lift vp their waues.
The Lord on high is mightier then the noise of many waters, yea then the mightie waues of the Sea.
Thy testimonies are very sure: holinesse becommeth thine house, O Lord, for euer. Heb. to length of dayes.
